result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin M Leggett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay back deductible to St. John's Baptist Church at 25% of prison wages w/ remaining balance on ES.
Maintain GFE in fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two.

No contact with St. John's Baptist Church, M.M., K.R., and co-defendant's T.E. & D.P.
Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.

Complete any assessment, treatment, and counseling deemed necessary by agent.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 11:17am
INCLUDES 15CF685, 15CF650, 14CF76
State appears by ADA Theresa Wetzsteon for ADA Ralph Uttke. Deft appears in person, in custody, pro se; writ from Dodge. Defense Atty Andrew Morgan does NOT appear.
Date and time set for restitution hearing


State says court clerk has tried

ad Prosequendum
5/9/16
Restitution hearing on May 9, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Plea and sentencing hearing on 3-11-2016.

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 1:35pm
INCLUDES 14CF76, 15CF650, and 15CF685
State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer; Deft appears in person, in custody, with Atty Andrew Morgan. 
Date and time set for sentencing hearing

State says here for argued SAR in 14CF76 and argued sentencing in 15CF685 & 15CF650. VRCW.
Atty Morgan does not have objections to SAR packet
State makes recommendation on sentencing based on PSI report
Atty Morgan does not object to states sentencing guidelines based on PSI
State makes arguments as to sentencing recommendations
Atty Morgan makes argument as to sentencing

COURT ORDERS: 15CF685 Ct. 1 (Burglary-Building or dwelling, PTAC): 10 years WSPS- 5 years IC, 5 years ES. 15CF650 Ct. 2 (Felon Possess Firearm- repeater): 10 years WSPS- 5 years IC, 5 years ES. Ct. 3 (Resisting or obstructing an officer- repeater): 2 years WSPS- 1 year IC, 1 year ES. All 3 counts of sentencing to run concurrent to each other. Granted 234 days credit on all 3 counts. 14CF76 Ct. 1 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs): 3 and half years WSPS- 1 and half years IC, 2 years ES, concurrent to all other sentencing. Granted 377 days credit for time served. Deft is eligible for both prison programs- Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse. CONDITIONS OF ES: No contact with St. John's Baptist Church, M.M., K.R. and co-defendants: T.E. and D. P. Pay back $1000 deductible to St. John's Baptist Church at 25% prison wages with remaining balance on ES, joint and several. Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Complete AODA assessment with follow through. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, subject to random testing to check for compliance. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of the two. Pay DNA sample and surcharge. Pay any other CC. 

State says will need to set separate restitution hearing at later date in 15CF650
COURT advises both parties to set restitution hearing in future with Br 1 JA

Deft is remanded to MC Sheriff's Dept to be transported to Dodge
Both parties to retain PSI reports in confidential manner
